docs.snippet: Lionel Messi and Ahmed Musa each scored two goals, but Argentina defeated Nigeria on Wednesday. Both teams advanced to the knockout stages.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lionel Messi and Ahmed Musa each scored two goals, but Argentina defeated Nigeria on Wednesday. Both teams advanced to the knockout stages.
docs.abstract: Argentina defeats Nigeria, 3-2, in group stage of the World Cup; both teams advance to Round of 16 knockout stage.

headline.seo: 2014 World Cup: Messi’s Two Goals Spark Argentina
headline.main: Messi Lifts Spirits of Argentines, Even Those Without Tickets
headline.print_headline: Messi Lifts Spirits of Argentines, Even Those Without Tickets

docs.snippet: Uruguay's Luis Suarez was hit with the longest ban imposed at a World Cup on Thursday as FIFA threw the book at one of soccer's most talented but controversial players for biting an opponent.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's Luis Suarez was hit with the longest ban imposed at a World Cup on Thursday as FIFA threw the book at one of soccer's most talented but controversial players for biting an opponent.

headline.main: World Cup Over for Suarez After Record Ban for Biting
headline.print_headline: World Cup Over for Suarez After Record Ban for Biting

docs.snippet: Italy captain Gianluigi Buffon admitted the Azzurri "made a bad impression" at the World Cup as the players returned home.
docs.lead_paragraph: Italy captain Gianluigi Buffon admitted the Azzurri "made a bad impression" at the World Cup as the players returned home.

headline.main: Italy Captain Buffon: We Made a Bad Impression
headline.print_headline: Italy Captain Buffon: We Made a Bad Impression

docs.snippet: As a dejected Italy team returned from a disappointing World Cup, there was one piece of good news with midfield maestro Andrea Pirlo saying he is considering reversing his decision to retire from international football.
docs.lead_paragraph: As a dejected Italy team returned from a disappointing World Cup, there was one piece of good news with midfield maestro Andrea Pirlo saying he is considering reversing his decision to retire from international football.

headline.main: Pirlo: I Will Remain Available for Italy
headline.print_headline: Pirlo: I Will Remain Available for Italy

docs.snippet: All Times EDTSaturday, June 28ARENA FOOTBALL10 p.m.
Luis Suarez exits the World Cup with one of the longest bans in tournament history, and his reputation once again in tatters.
docs.lead_paragraph: Luis Suarez exits the World Cup with one of the longest bans in tournament history, and his reputation once again in tatters.

headline.main: FIFA Bans Suarez for 4 Months for Biting Opponent
headline.print_headline: FIFA Bans Suarez for 4 Months for Biting Opponent

docs.snippet: Media release on Luis Suarez issued by soccer's world governing body FIFA on Thursday.
docs.lead_paragraph: Media release on Luis Suarez issued by soccer's world governing body FIFA on Thursday.

docs.snippet: Uruguay's Luis Suarez, one of the world's best but also most volatile footballers, received a nine-match ban on Thursday and was suspended from any football-related activity for four months for biting an Italian defender at the World Cup.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguay's Luis Suarez, one of the world's best but also most volatile footballers, received a nine-match ban on Thursday and was suspended from any football-related activity for four months for biting an Italian defender at the World Cup.

docs.snippet: When the coach needs to lighten up, squirt some water on him.
docs.lead_paragraph: When the coach needs to lighten up, squirt some water on him.

headline.main: BRAZIL BEAT: Argentina's 'El Pocho' Lightens Mood
headline.print_headline: BRAZIL BEAT: Argentina's 'El Pocho' Lightens Mood

docs.snippet: Uruguayans were incensed on Thursday after FIFA suspended their star striker Luis Suarez for nine matches for biting Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini, with many slamming the ban as exaggerated, hypocritical, or even biased.
docs.lead_paragraph: Uruguayans were incensed on Thursday after FIFA suspended their star striker Luis Suarez for nine matches for biting Italian defender Giorgio Chiellini, with many slamming the ban as exaggerated, hypocritical, or even biased.

headline.main: Fuming Uruguay Sees Red Over Ban on Hero Suarez
headline.print_headline: Fuming Uruguay Sees Red Over Ban on Hero Suarez
